[The crypt appears to lead into a long corridor on the other side of this locked gate. If the thick dust is any indication, this part of the keep has not been used for many years.]||***ga_jump_players-->String::swordskeepb_vwp Int::1 Int::0 ***gc_is_in_combat-->NOT::True String::$PC_SPEAKER ||
[Pick the gate's lock.]|***gc_skill_rank-->NOT::False Int::15 Int::1 |
[You carefully undo the rusty mechanism that latches the gate in place.]|***gc_skill_dc-->NOT::False Int::15 Int::15 |
|***ga_give_xp-->Int::100    Int::0    ***ga_door_open-->String::swordskeep_b_door    |
It does not seem to me as if we have a reason to be doing this.|***gc_comp_remove-->NOT::False    String::ianth    |
Do not question my decision, Ianth.|***ga_global_int-->String::abrasive    String::++    |
Oh, do we need one?|***ga_global_int-->String::ironic    String::++    |
Curiosity and adventure, Ianth.

I happen to agree with in this. I mean, this is the crypt where my brother is buried--if anyone had reason to complain, it would be me. But I remain content--pleased, even. Adventure is not for the overly scrupulous.|***gc_comp_remove-->NOT::False String::vroman |
Well, be glad that I worship Sune, and not Tyr.
Indeed.  Perhaps we will find an antique silk chemise for you.|***gc_comp_remove-->NOT::False    String::vroman    |
Such a thing would fit you far better than I.
In any case, <FirstName>, let us get this over with.
[Try as you might, the rusty mechanism holding the gate's latch in place will not move.]
[Break the latch holding the gate in place.]|***gc_check_stats-->NOT::False Int::0 Int::15 |
[The latch clatters to the floor, and the gate opens easily.]
|***ga_door_open-->String::swordskeep_b_door    |
